main event: A round object was observed in the sky over Oregon City, Oregon on July 17, 1958.
interesting points: The object was described as round, with one side being more distinct than the other, and changing in color from red with a yellow halo to white and grey.
The object disappeared instantaneously from where it was first sighted.
The sighting lasted for approximately 3-5 minutes.
The observer happened to look up and spotted the object about 50 degrees above the horizon.
The report concludes that the object was possibly a balloon, but there is insufficient data to make a definitive evaluation.
photographs: Yes, the report includes photographs, but no photograph is present in the provided image.
